Package com.iontrading.mkv

Class MkvEntitlementManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iontrading.mkv.MkvEntitlementManager
  • @Keep
@KeepPublicClassMemberNames
public class MkvEntitlementManager
extends Object
    This class provides access to entitlement service facilities.

    In order to authorize a feature to a specific user a request must be issued against an entitlement server; please refer to the Entitlement Server documentation for details.

    This class allows to issue an asynchronous request by means of any of the eval() methods Request outcomes can be cached so to be retrieved synchronously at a later time using the cacheQuery(com.iontrading.mkv.MkvEntitlementRequest) method.

    Asynchronous request completion is notified to a user provided instance of a class implementing specific interface, either the MkvEntitlementRequestEvalListener interface or the MkvEntitlementsQueryExecuteListener interface.

    This class provides three different variations of the basic eval() method:

    • single resource check: this method is useful to check a single permission on a single resource.

      E.g.: you want to check if user 'mkv' is entitled to perform a 'subscribe' operation on record 'EUR.PRICING_MAIN.PXE.FR00106'.

    • multiple resource entitlement query: this method is much more powerful than the previous one, since it allows the user to perform multiple checks on several combinations of both operations and resources all at the same time, with just one remote call to the Entitlement Server.

      E.g.: you want to check if user 'mkv' is entitled to perform any of the following operations, 'subscribe', 'trade' and 'tradeonbehalfof', on the following resources: 'EUR.PRICING_MAIN.PXE.FR00106', 'EUR.PRICING_MAIN.PXE.FR00107' and 'EUR.PRICING_MAIN.PXE.FR00108'.

      Conceptually, in order to gather the above pieces of information, user can perform multiple, subsequent calls to the basic eval() method and collect the resulting entitlements. But this is complex and not even performance efficient.

      Instead, using this advanced version of eval(), user can produce a flexible MkvEntitlements.Query object, describing his needs and all the services, resources and features he is interested in.

      The so-created query can be used to remotely invoke the Entitlement Server, just once, verify all the associated entitlements at the Entitlement Server side and obtain the list of entitled resources in just one shot.

      For a comprehensive guide and examples of how to build a MkvEntitlements.Query object, please refer to MkvEntitlements .

    • multiple resource entitlement query with optional, business-dependent parameters: this method is same as the above one, but allows the user to also provide additional, custom and business-dependent parameters to the function call, provided in the form of MkvSupply object.

      This method only matters if you are communicating with a custom entitlement server component, which is able to correctly interpret your additional parameters. The standard ION Entitlement Server will just ignore the additional parameters, if supplied.

    Unanswered requests within a timeout expire and fail.

    Successful call completion will be notified through the user-specified completion object. For single resource check, this object is supposed to implement the MkvEntitlementRequestEvalListener interface and all the relevant results will be provided on the associated MkvEntitlementRequestEvalListener.onRequestEvaluated(com.iontrading.mkv.MkvEntitlementRequest, com.iontrading.mkv.enums.MkvEntitlementPermission) method.

    The multiple resource entitlement queries, instead, require the user to specify an object of type MkvEntitlementsQueryExecuteListener. The MkvEntitlementsQueryExecuteListener.onQueryExecuted(com.iontrading.mkv.MkvEntitlements.Query, com.iontrading.mkv.enums.MkvEntitlementPermission, com.iontrading.mkv.MkvEntitlements.EntitlementsIterator) method of this interface is responsible to deliver all the relevant results of the query.

    Please, refer to MkvEntitlements for a comprehensive guide and examples of how to handle the results by giving a pertinent implemementation of this method.



    The class also supports in-memory rule evaluation of the Entitlement requests via the following APIs. These evaluations will be served by the Bulk Entitlement API that cached the Entitlement Server data locally and performs the rule evaluation against the in-memory cache.
    It's responsibility of the Bulk Entitlement API to always keep the local data cache in synch with the Entitlement Server configuration.
    Here are the in-memory rule evaluation APIs:

    • startBulkQueryService(String, IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory): Start a Bulk Query Service by which the Bulk Entitlement API will take care of incoming function calls and MessageQueue response handling.


    • bulkQuery(com.iontrading.mkv.bulkentitlements.IMkvBulkEntitlementRequest, com.iontrading.mkv.bulkentitlements.IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory, java.lang.String, com.iontrading.mkv.bulkentitlements.IMkvBulkEntitlementRequestListener): Bulk query for a generic set of resource and features to be evaluated all at once.


    • eval(com.iontrading.mkv.MkvEntitlementRequest, com.iontrading.mkv.events.MkvEntitlementRequestEvalListener): Single in-memory resource check, this method is useful to check a single permission on a single resource.

    Please, refer to IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory for a comprehensive guide and examples of how to use the Bulk Entitlement API.



    The user can install an optional listener to monitor the availability of the entitlement server using the addEntitlementServiceListener(com.iontrading.mkv.events.MkvEntitlementServiceListener) method.

    The in-memory engine status can be optionally monitored using the addMkvESLibStatusListener(IMkvESLibStatusListener) method.
    See Also:
    MkvEntitlementManager, IMkvESLibStatusListener, MkvESLibStatus, startBulkQueryService(String, IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory), publishQueryUserEntitlementsFunServer(com.iontrading.mkv.events.MkvFunctionListener), bulkQuery(IMkvBulkEntitlementRequest, IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory, String, IMkvBulkEntitlementRequestListener), MkvBulkEntitlementRequest, IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory, IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStream, IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceCallback, IMkvBulkEntitlementRequestListener, MkvBulkEntitlementQuery, Mkv.getEntitlementManager(), MkvEntitlements

    • Method Detail

      • resetAllQueryCaches

        public void resetAllQueryCaches()
        Clears up the entitlement requests cache for all sources.

      • resetQueryCache

        public void resetQueryCache​(String entSource)
        Clears up the entitlement requests cache for the specified source. This clears up the cache for all configured namespaces and for all users. This happens whenever the ES becomes available on the ION Platform as well as the ESLib switches to READY state.
        Parameters:
        entSource - the source to clean up.

      • resetQueryCacheForUsers

        public void resetQueryCacheForUsers​(String entSource,
                                    List<String> users)
        Clears up the entitlement requests cache for the specified source and users This clears up the cache for the specified users across all configured namespaces. This happens whenever the ES becomes available on the ION Platform as well as the ESLib switches to READY state. This is also the case when changing certain user/group/profile associations.
        Parameters:
        entSource - the source to clean up.
        users - the optionally null/empty list of affected users, for which the permissions cache has to be cleared. if null/empty, all user caches will be cleared.

      • resetQueryCache

        public void resetQueryCache​(String entSource,
                            String namespace)
        Clears up the entitlement requests cache for the specified source and namespace. This clears up the cache for all configured users within the specified namespace only. This happens whenever the ES namespace switches to ACTIVE or whenever a configuration change happens on the ES that cannot be directly associated with specific users.
        Parameters:
        entSource - the source to clean up.
        namespace - the namespace to clean up.

      • resetQueryCache

        public void resetQueryCache​(String entSource,
                            String namespace,
                            List<String> users)
        Clears up the entitlement requests cache for the specified source and namespace. This clears up the cache for all configured users within the specified namespace only. This happens whenever the ES namespace switches to ACTIVE or whenever a configuration change happens on the ES that cannot be directly associated with specific users.
        Parameters:
        entSource - the source to clean up.
        namespace - the namespace to clean up.
        users - the optionally null/empty list of affected users, for which the permissions cache has to be cleared. if null/empty, all user caches will be cleared.

      • resetQueryCache

        public void resetQueryCache​(String entSource,
                            MkvNamespace namespaceObj,
                            List<String> users)
        Clears up the entitlement requests cache for the specified source, namespace and user list. This clears up the specific user cache within the specified namespace only. This happens whenever a configuration change happens on the ES that can be directly associated with specific users.
        Parameters:
        entSource - the source to clean up.
        namespaceObj - the namespace to clean up.
        users - the optionally null/empty list of affected users, for which the permissions cache has to be cleared. if null/empty, all user caches will be cleared.

        public void deregisterExternalStatusRecord​(String source)

      • getConfigServiceSource

        public String getConfigServiceSource()
        Returns the source for the entitlements as set up by the "ENT_SOURCE" configuration property.

        If no value is specified for this property, the component will access entitlement service from any entitlement server it has been connected to. If a source is specified, the service will be available only if the entitlement server the component has been connected to matches the specified source; last, the special value "_AUTODISCOVERY_" enables auto-discovery mode. When auto-discovery mode is enabled, the component connects on its own to a platform entitlement server if any available.

        Returns:
        the configured entitlements source.

      • getRequestExpirationValue

        public int getRequestExpirationValue()
        Returns the expiration timeout for entitlement evaluation requests. The timeout is obtained from the "ENT_REQTIMEOUT" configuration property.
        Returns:
        the expiration timeout for entitlement evaluation requests.

      • isAutoDiscoveryMode

        public boolean isAutoDiscoveryMode()
        Returns true if auto-discovery mode is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if auto-discovery mode is enabled.
        See Also:

      • eval

        public void eval​(MkvEntitlementRequest req,
                 MkvEntitlementRequestEvalListener lner)
        Request evaluation of an entitlement request, putting the request in a queue of pending evaluation. A dedicated thread will periodically dequeue the pending requests and evaluate them.

        The result for the evaluation of the request is returned asynchronously to the associated MkvEntitlementRequestEvalListener object.

        The results returned from the entitlement service provider are cached; if the service is not available, a request can still be evaluated successfully if a cached result is present.

        Parameters:
        req - an entitlement request object.
        lner - a listener to which return the result for an evaluation request

      • evalImmediate

        public void evalImmediate​(MkvEntitlementRequest req,
                          MkvEntitlementRequestEvalListener lner)
        Request evaluation of an entitlement request, performing the evaluation in-stack with the caller.

        The result for the evaluation of the request is returned in-stack to the associated MkvEntitlementRequestEvalListener object.

        The results returned from the entitlement service provider are cached; if the service is not available, a request can still be evaluated successfully if a cached result is present.

        Parameters:
        req - an entitlement request object.
        lner - a listener to which return the result for an evaluation request

      • eval

        public void eval​(MkvEntitlementRequest req,
                 MkvEntitlementListEvalListener llner)

      • eval

        public void eval​(MkvEntitlements.Query query,
                 MkvEntitlementsQueryExecuteListener lner)
        Request evaluation of an entitlement query.

        The result for the evaluation of the request is returned asynchronously to the associated MkvEntitlementsQueryExecuteListener object.

        The results returned from the entitlement service provider can be cached.

        Parameters:
        query - an entitlements query object.
        lner - a listener to which return the result for an evaluation request

      • eval

        public void eval​(MkvEntitlements.Query query,
                 MkvSupply customParameters,
                 MkvEntitlementsQueryExecuteListener lner)
        Request evaluation of an entitlement query with custom parameters.

        The result for the evaluation of the request is returned asynchronously to the associated MkvEntitlementsQueryExecuteListener object.

        The results returned from the entitlement service provider can be cached.

        Parameters:
        query - an entitlements query object.
        customParameters - specify custom parameters to be forwarded to the Entitlement Server / delegate for permission evaluation
        lner - a listener to which return the result for an evaluation request

      • publishQueryUserEntitlementsFunServer

        public MkvFunction publishQueryUserEntitlementsFunServer​(MkvFunctionListener lner)
                                                  throws MkvException
        Publish a new function on server-side, called "queryUserEntitlements" with the correct parameters (a String for user name, a String for query, and other variadic custom arguments)
        Parameters:
        lner - the application-level function listener
        Returns:
        MkvFunction the newly created function, already bounded with specified listener
        Throws:
        MkvException - if the API is not running.

      • cacheQuery

        public MkvEntitlementPermission cacheQuery​(MkvEntitlementRequest req)
        Queries the entitlement requests cache.

        This method provides a synchronous alternative to eval(com.iontrading.mkv.MkvEntitlementRequest, com.iontrading.mkv.events.MkvEntitlementRequestEvalListener) for queries which have already been replied at an earlier time.

        Parameters:
        req - an entitlement request object.
        Returns:
        the permission for the request, or null in case a result for the request is not in the cache.

      • resetQueryCaches

        public void resetQueryCaches()
        Clears up the entitlement requests caches for all sources.

      • bulkQueryFunctionPublish

        public void bulkQueryFunctionPublish​(String source,
                                     MkvFunctionListener listener)
        Publishes the Bulk Entitlement Query function on the ION Bus The function is part of the Bulk Entitlement protocol and it will have the following signature: 
            STR 'source'_SearchEntitlements ( STR Namespace, STR UserName, STR ResourceFilter, STR FeatureName )
        The function result is expected to be:
        • 0:Ok, QUEUENAME, 'message queue name'
        • 'error code':'error message'
        Parameters:
        source - the application source for publishing the Bulk Entitlement Query function
        listener - an application-level listener for replying to the incoming function calls

      • bulkQuery

        public MkvBulkEntitlementQuery bulkQuery​(IMkvBulkEntitlementRequest request,
                                         IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory factory,
                                         String resourceFilter,
                                         IMkvBulkEntitlementRequestListener listener)
        This method initiate a Bulk Entitlement Query on the underlying cache
        Parameters:
        request - The Bulk Entitlement Request to be evaluated
        factory - The IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory to use to create the proper Resource iterator required for this query
        resourceFilter - The resource filtering string for this query
        listener - The application listener to notify for all the results
        Returns:
        an MkvBulkEntitlementQuery wrapping the current ongoing query

                                  IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory factory)
        This method starts a Bulk Entitlement Query service for the specified Entitlement Namespace
        Parameters:
        entitlementNamespace - The Entitlement Namespace that the newly created service will handle
        factory - The IMkvBulkEntitlementResourceStreamFactory to use to create the proper Resource iterator required for any incoming query on the service
